rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTESTCD

self.title: ECG Test or Examination Short Name

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in EGTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in EGTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). EGTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples :PRMEAN, QTMEAN
datasetVariables.label: ECG Test or Examination Short Name
datasetVariables.name: EGTESTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the ECG measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples of expected values are 62 or 0.151 when the result is an interval or measurement, or "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION" or "QT PROLONGATION" when the result is a finding.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: EGORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for EGORRES. Examples: sec or msec.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: EGORRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71150

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from EGORRES in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in EGORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in EGSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions. Additional examples of result data: SINUS BRADYCARDIA, ATRIAL FLUTTER, ATRIAL FIBRILLATION.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from EGSTRESC. EGSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGSTRESU

datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: EGSTRESU

datasetVariables.label: Reason ECG Not Performed
datasetVariables.name: EGREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGBLFL

datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: EGBLFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records which represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If EGDRVFL=Y, then EGORRES could be null, with EGSTRESC, and (if numeric) EGSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: EGDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: EGEVAL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTPT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Text Description of time when measurement should be taken. 2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See EGTPTNUM and EGTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: EGTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTPTNUM

datasetVariables.name: EGTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (EGTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: EGELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by EGELTM, EGTPTNUM, and EGTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: EGTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable EG.EGRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of the reference time point, EGTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: EGRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains ECG data, including position of the subject, method of evaluation, all cycle measurements and all findings from the ECG including an overall interpretation if collected or derived. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49626, 2018-06-29)
label: ECG
name: EG
